All kinds of this plant are of the colour of boxwood, and have small stems and purple blossom. They bear small berries like caper bei-ries. Only the root has medi- cinal value. There is also a fourth kind, called plistolochia, more slender than the one last mentioned, with dense, hair-like masses for a root, and of the thickness of a stoutish rush, which some surname polyrrhizos.
